basics.name: Dmitry Verhoturov
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: 7+ years of system engineering expertise, working with linux servers.

work.summary: IPonWeb (250+ employees) provides technology to advertising industry, Real Time Bidding auctions in particular — company handles millions of transactions every minute, terabytes of data stored and processed every day. I created previously non-existent team of engineers who ensure company services working 24/7/365.
highlights: Wrote a lot of code in Puppet, Fabric Python framework, Boto framework (used for interaction with AWS and GCE services), SQL.

Experience of work with huge variation of Amazon and Google services. I know how their support is organized and know how to handle any kinds of problems with cloud providers, I've spent hours doing so.
Part of my work is to implement changes, and I know well how to make other people do what I need. I interact with literally every team in the company in progress of introducing improvements.
Creation and integration on-duty procedures, by which duty shifts are operating since then.
Creation a new team of seven people in three cities from scratch.
Creation of a ton of documentation and couple of videos for internal education.

work.summary: Svyaznoy Zagrugka (~40 employees) is a telecommunication content provider, it powers services which send and receive SMS messages and USSD requests, and gives that ability to hundreds of partners. I handled client integration and support. My day-to-day activity was monitoring improvements and troubleshooting problems (network and application levels, Wireshark and SQL console were by best friends).
highlights: Created Python+Flask web application for recurring task (network dump cut by time and client).

Maintained and monitored the company’s software, self-written parts is Java, served by Glassfish and Tomcat — I've got experience of these systems tuning and Java software debugging and proper errors reporting.
Rewrote tens of monitoring and other scripts to python from perl and bash, as well as created a dozen of new ones.
Maintained and tuned the IT infrastructure of the company. Every day, I worked with virtualization (VMware), Linux (CentOS, Debian), and SQL (MySQL, MSSQL).

Interaction with other company technical departments, troubleshooting and fixing problems. I was the one detecting if problem is on our or client's side, and I found ways to fix problems on client's side no matter if they are tech-savvy or not.

work.summary: Served army for one year after obtaining my degree.
70 employees company, Biochemmack resells medical equipment. Initially, I was working with medical devices; later, I shifted into internal services support.
highlights: Created and populated a wiki with information about internal infrastructure.
Technical support of company partners, I have read tens of books of documentation and fixed different kind of problems with software and hardware (for example used for the analysis of DNA).
Migrated server from the old CentOS to Ubuntu, reviewed and rewrote configuration of all used linux services and networking.
Developed autonomous work of local network parts in case of events, such as a breakage of the main channel of communication or interrupted local connectivity.

work.summary: 10 employees in 3 different locations, my job was local system engineer.
highlights: Established a network setup that is still in use without changes.
Created a documentation on company infrastructure for future engineers use.
As a initiative, participated in site development, SEO and advertising.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered in a search-and-rescue organization, looking for a lost children.

education.summary: I became my group headmen on the second year of study and held this position for five years, doing all the organizational work. I've held unofficial university site, created by inspiration from https://xkcd.com/773/
